title: The evangelical wave surging across Brazil
summary: In the world's largest Catholic country, evangelicals are making their mark on the political scene. Their ascent seems undisturbed by the scandals involving their leaders or links with drug traffickers.

title: Flooding in Northern France: 'It's only logical that rainfall will become more frequent and intense'
summary: For weather forecaster François Gourand, the impact of global warming can be seen in the level of precipitation across northern Europe.

title: Russian strike in eastern Ukraine kills at least 11 people
summary: Ukrainian officials reported on Saturday that eight people were also wounded when Russian forces hit the area with S-300 missiles.

title: 'Qatargate': Belgian investigation risks stalling
summary: Over a year since the police raid in Brussels that exposed a corruption scandal in the European Parliament, there is uncertainty over whether the case will ever come to court.

title: Senegal: Ousmane Sonko's prospect for presidential candidacy increasingly uncertain
summary: While candidacy applications for the February 25 election are being examined, the main opposition candidate has had one of his sentences upheld by the Supreme Court, which could render him ineligible.

title: AI start-ups are booming in San Francisco's 'Cerebral Valley'
summary: A new generation of 'techies' has settled in Hayes Valley, the epicenter of a booming tech world. Here, AI creators are convinced that they are taking part in a 'civilizational change' that in the long term will benefit humanity.

title: Between North and South Korea, 2024 begins under high tension
summary: On Friday, North Korea fired 192 shells into the Yellow Sea, in the buffer zone that separates it from the South, forcing Seoul to shelter the inhabitants of two islands. This show of force follows a record number of missile launches by Pyongyang in 2023.

title: Polish farmers suspend their blockade at Ukrainian border
summary: Polish farmers who had blockaded a border crossing to Ukraine ended their protest after reaching an agreement with the government that met their demands.

title: Our best addresses for raisin bread
summary: With blond or brown raisins, rum or Madagascar vanilla pastry cream, abundant filling or crispy puff pastry... Where in France can you enjoy a delicious raisin bread?

title: One day, there was a miracle: 'My dating app bugged, and I came across him'
summary: Aurore Durand, 28, a data manager in southwestern France, found love thanks to an algorithm error.

title: Hezbollah fires rockets at Israel
summary: Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah said Friday that his group would retaliate after the killing, in a strike attributed to Israel, of a Hamas leader in Lebanon.

title: Paris 2024: Culture institutions anxious over lack of details as Games approach
summary: Museums, theaters and concert halls are feeling uneasy, seven months ahead of the 2024 Paris Olympics. They face unpredictable opening times, with partial, total or sporadic closures.

title: Death toll from Japan earthquake rises past 120
summary: More than 200 people were still unaccounted for, although the number has fluctuated. 11 people were reported trapped under two homes that collapsed in Anamizu.

title: Six iconic design objects, from the UN chair to the Ankara table
summary: These six designs have gone down in history for their sleek styles and functionality. Now they can be found in people's homes, as a coveted design object.

title: What legacy for Paris 2024? The difficult aftermath of the Athens 2004 Olympics
summary: While the event provided the Greek capital with much-needed infrastructure, the lack of stadium maintenance and the impact of high organization costs on the country's finances tainted the aftermath of the festivities.

title: China's military purge continues
summary: Beijing appointed a new defense minister while simultaneously declaring the expulsion of nine senior army officers. Eleven years into his presidency, Xi Jinping continues to prioritize the battle against corruption as a central aspect of his governance system.

title: Alaska Airlines grounds 737-9 aircraft after window blows out midair
summary: The plane landed safely with 174 passengers and six crew members, the airline said.

title: Why Middle East stability revolves around Israel
summary: Le Monde looks back at the history of Israel's relations with its Arab neighbors and the intractable and complicated quest for peace in the Middle East, made of alliances and betrayals.

title: US regulator orders grounding of Boeing MAX 9 planes after Alaska Airlines incident
summary: Federal officials on Saturday ordered the immediate grounding and inspection of some Boeing 737 Max 9 planes following an emergency landing by an Alaska Airlines plane due to a window panel blowout post-takeoff.

title: Belarus: The opposition tries to get out of Lukashenko's trap
summary: The Belarusian leader is blocking exiled critics from renewing their documents abroad to force their return. Meanwhile, Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya's alternative government is pushing for EU recognition of their new passports.

title: After rift caused by Depardieu, how can French cinema pick up the pieces?
summary: The accusations against the actor and the flurry of letters and op-eds have shaken France's cultural world, which was thought to be relatively united. How do you work together after such a debacle?

title: The disappearance of local newspapers in the US weighs on democracy
summary: In 2023, more than 130 publications had closed or been merged. One in five Americans now lives in an area lacking in news coverage. As the November 2024 presidential election approaches, initiatives are springing up to reverse the trend.

title: Where to travel in 2024: Le Monde's top 10 destinations in France and Europe
summary: This year, Le Monde takes you pedaling between the volcanoes of Auvergne, walking on the breathtaking Aletsch Glacier, strolling in Zaragoza and cycling among volcanic sleeping beauties.

title: French foreign minister urges Iran to stop 'destabilizing acts'
summary: Catherine Colonna's call with her counterpart Amir Abdollahian came after the Iran-backed Hezbollah group in Lebanon said it had targeted an Israeli base with 62 missiles in response to the killing of a Hamas leader in Beirut.

title: Our selection of the 15 best galettes
summary: There are those who swear by the traditional frangipane, those who like the originality of an ice cream or crumbly galette and those who are after a gluten-free or chocolate option. Follow the guide to find your favorite... and the hidden lucky charm!

title: Bangladesh votes in election boycotted by opposition
summary: The country votes Sunday in an election guaranteed to give a fifth term in office to Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

title: From Paris to Marseille, French museums report record attendance in 2023
summary: Most of France's cultural institutions, in Paris and in the rest of the country, have regained their pre-pandemic visitors.

title: Nadal out of Australian Open with muscle tear
summary: The tennis champion had made his comeback from a year-long injury absence just a week ago.

title: War in Gaza: The shadow of Alexander the Great's siege
summary: To find a tragedy on the scale of the one happening today in Gaza, we'd have to go back to Alexander the Great's merciless siege of the city in 332 BC, writes Le Monde columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu.

title: EU Council President Charles Michel to step down early
summary: The Belgian has announced that he will step down early as European Council president after running in the European Parliament elections in June, raising questions about who will take over.

title: Iran woman gets 74 lashes for 'violating public morals'
summary: Roya Heshmati was also ordered to pay a fine of 12 million rials (around $25) for "not wearing the Muslim veil in public," her lawyer said.

title: Mental training for athletes, a business exploited by 'charlatans'
summary: The absence of an official mental trainer certification leads to diversity in the qualification of practitioners, a situation prone to abusive tactics.

title: The 'disobedient' children of Argentina's torturers
summary: The daughters and sons of men accused of actively participating in repression during the dictatorship (1976-1983) are slowly discovering a past that has long remained secret. Some don't hesitate to disown their fathers.

title: Companies imitate luxury hotel room service to entice employees back to the office
summary: Covid-19 has permanently kept employees away from their open-plan offices. To reverse the trend, some employers are drawing on the luxury hotel industry's practices.

title: Bangladesh's Hasina wins re-election after polls boycotted by opposition
summary: Hasina's ruling Awami League 'has won more than 50 percent seats,' an Election Commission spokesman said on Sunday, with counting ongoing.

title: Taiwan's young voters prepare for pivotal election, ambivalent about China and their future
summary: These young Taiwanese in their twenties are preparing to vote in their first election on January 13. While they are aware of the threat China poses to their island and its democracy, they are nevertheless seduced by their powerful neighbor's culture and promises of prosperity.
